title: Economics and Management of Community Development
overview: Economics and Management of Community Development is a course that provides students with knowledge, methods, and skills in community development, including an overview of communities and community development, objectives and motivations for community development, economic and management of community development resources, community development institutions, organizational and management methods, project investment development construction and management, and economic and management of key communities.

skill_outcomes.outcome_description: Students will understand the basic knowledge about communities and community development, including the objectives and motivations for community development.

Students will be equipped with methods and skills for building objectives and motivations for community development, as well as for resource mobilization, planning, participation mobilization, meeting organization, activity organization, project construction and management.
Students will be able to independently study and research to complete assigned tasks and draw conclusions on economic and management issues in community development.
